name: Charles Pan-Fried Chicken
address: 340 W 145th St, New York, NY 10039, USA

reviews.text: Amazing customer service from Naomi and nitza!
The red velvet is amazing and the customer service is good. Thanks Rica !!
Poppa

Theeee best!!!!!
Uncle Charles is the best hands down.  I dont even fry my own I let him fry it and bring it home. It lasts me at least three days. Don't meet me there beat me there. Yes you may have to wait but its worth it
Mr. Charles makes the best fried chicken in NYC. üíØ

Recommended by a local. Food was cooked fresh and seasoned to perfection. Chicken was crispy and tender, greens well seasoned, yams sweet and tasty. The cornbread was dense but moist, sweet but not too sweet. No photo unfortunately but it was delicious with the dipping sauces

The fried chicken and turkey are terrific!  So are sides like collards and beans. I also tried the catfish tacos, which are big pieces of fried catfish inside tortillas with sweet sauce and coleslaw.  These were just too sweet and rich for me.  The drinks are also all too sweet for me, so I get water.  The people are nice but service is functional and kind of brusk.  Not really a problem if you come expecting it.  Great chicken.
Half and half is amazing! As well as the collard greens..
All around excellent food and service
Great food and great service, great vibes overall! Elijah is a hard worker
Tyla and rica were amazing i love this place ü•∞‚Ä¶
Best food
This taste my great grandma fried chicken. Would come back again!
Janel was very welcoming and funny. He made me feel safe in a new space!!
The catfish tacos were a hit and Roca has great customer service !!
Janele and Naomi were fantastic and created a great atmosphere soon as we walked in! Customer service was incredible. I recommend everyone to come!

Absolutely outstanding experience!
Jannel and Naomi provided exceptional hospitality from the moment I walked in. They were friendly, attentive, and genuinely helpful in guiding my ordering choices. Their recommendations were spot-on‚Äîthe food was absolutely amazing! The quality, flavor, and presentation exceeded expectations. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back. Highly recommend!
Janel and Naomi were the absolute best! Top tier service, quick and the food was even better!!!!
Charles pan fried is the best in the neighborhood. Janel was quick and super welcoming and friendly. made the whole experience fantastic! 10/10

Jamel is amazing he shared a tip for Papaya to have with his corn bread which is his favourite‚Ä¶.. always so kind and generous and full of life was so so great to come in and end our day with him on our way home!!!!!! üíïüíïüíï thank you for every encounter this is the first time i‚Äôve written a review but definitely not our first time being invited and served by him in his home that‚Äôs what it feels like when we come in warm and inviting always. merci beaucoup pour ca xx
Janelle and Naomi did us right!! Can‚Äôt wait to come back

My friend and I got the fried chicken meal and used their outdoor seating. It was delicious and the portion size is perfect for 2 people to share. Will definitely visit next time I‚Äôm in that area. Keep up the good work.
Thank you Naomi amazing customer service a1
Poppa was so kind.

On October 9th, 2025
I made my first take out order!!! It was Amazing ü§©The ribs slid off the bone! Tender! Perfect flavor!
And the fried chicken reminded me of my late mother‚Äôs fried chicken. The mac&cheese, cornbread, collard greens. Peach cobbler was absolute perfection!! This is Soul Food Heaven
Rica has amazing service. The food is good.
Rica has amazing service.
Rica is amazing
Happy birthday my G. Thank you.
Came through with the family and the staff was amazing.  And wishing Janel a happy brithday
Excellent customer service! Very friendly and polite. Food is always amazing.Also Happy Birthday Janel !!)
The workers were very kind and the food is amazing
Happy Birthday Janell great service !
Excellent service Janel more life to ya!
Happy Birthday Janel!!! Thank you for providing such good customer service. The food is amazing as ALWAYS. I love coming to this location. 10/10.
Place has great vibes, and I hope Janel has a great birthday!!
Shout out and happy birthday to Janel amazing service. The food is always fresh and delicious and the people are amazing.
The food was amazing and happy birthday to Janel!
Best fried chicken in Harlem ‚Äî crispy, juicy, and full of flavor! Big thanks to Charles and the team for the amazing food (and the cornbread!). Also happy birthday to Janel!
Food amazing, happy birthday jenelle
Happy Birthday to a good brother Janelle have a good one
Happy day to Janel
This is my go-to spot in the neighborhood. Janel, Naomi, and the rest of the crew in there are always bringing the good energy & the food is always 10/10.

On 11/5/25. I bought the mashed potato and fried chicken.  The mashed potato tasted like it was instant.  I knew from the look of it that this was not the same as it was before, but i went against my instinct.   In the past the mashed potato was good but this was terrible.  My friend had the collard greens and she said it had no taste.  The corn bread tasted mushy. The chicken was good and that's was about it. I'm giving charles pan chicken a break for now,  maybe they will get better.

Naomi‚Äôs has amazing customer service
. My fav lunch spot
Service was amazing and Rica has amazing customers service!
Rica was great! Amazing customer service!
classic Harlem fried chicken joint! üòã thanks Janel & Poppa!
I don‚Äôt appreciate how they gave me this dry ass Mac k cheese. My first time and my last. Not worth any travel. I can make better tasting fried chicken. 145th

I‚Äôve been going to Charles for years, from when he was at the restaurant located by 155th street.

Food was better than too‚Ä¶and cheaper.

The food is still good, I was skeptical when he expanded because I know how often the quality goes down. I‚Äôd say, it‚Äôs still pretty good.

I always get the smothered fried chicken (extra gravy) with collard greens and macaroni & cheese. I used to get the yams but they‚Äôd been lacking in real authentic flavor so I skip them.

Cornbread 5/5. Tasty, right amount of sweetness, slightly fluffy.

Collard greens 4.5/5. Pretty good, add some meat and I‚Äôd rate it a five. Seasoned well, cooked slowly and they‚Äôre not canned.

Smothered fried chicken 5/5. My fave dish. This man can do the hell out of some gravy. Chicken is always cooked well and seasoned to perfection. Oh and I always ask for and they give me extra gravy.

Macaroni and cheese 4.5/5. It‚Äôs been getting better since the expansion. Sometimes, it‚Äôd be good and other times it‚Äôs just okay. Right amount of cheese in it.

Fruit Punch 3/5. Typical koolaid. Not crazy about it but I always drink it. I wish they‚Äôd offer a half and half or Arnold Palmer. I‚Äôll try the sweet tea one day too.

Overall, I could write more, but an easy 5/5 for ME. I appreciate that he‚Äôs a southern black American man running this restaurant, lots of other soul food joints are ran by others. I have an old review from his old spot on Yelp, but this is pretty good. Keep up the excellent work sir!

I rarely give 5 stars but this place gets 5 stars!  The food is amazing!  The flavors are so subtle but rich!  The yams have an amazing rich taste but so subtle.  The black eyed peas are so delicious but such a subtle seasoning. My only complaint is that this place is pretty much take out only.  No good seating here.

This is hands down the best fried chicken I've ever had! Make sure you go early so that they don't run out of sides. The service could be better but I know the place stays packed and the workers are always very busy. I definitely wish they had more seating and a public restroom for paying customers would be nice but it is definitely worth the trip!

Heard about this place for years and finally got a chance to try it. It was worth the long wait, I will not wait as long to return. This fried chicken might not be what you're used to, but the flavor is incredible. Real dark meat that it crisp and not overly crunchy. That's why people love it! Cornbread is equally old school, not some fluffy stuff. Collards were excellent- meaty tasting and so tender, even the stems were soft to the tooth. The staff is friendly, professional and also entertaining. Will return soon!

Great spot Right on the Corner the way it should be In HaRLem
Much Love ‚ù§Ô∏è
To The Crew Working
And Service
Amazing Fried chicken üçó üêî üòã
Collard Greens
Candy üç¨  yams üç† üòã
Dessert cheesecake
Peach cobbler
Mac & Chesse top of the list in Manhattan...
Fish Fry is Perfect....thank you
For the Service
Welcome to CHarles Pan Fried!
Please üôèüèΩ don't Forget the Traditional Kool aid just like In Your Mommas Houseü•§
The Ribs And Cornbread ü´°ü§≠

Might have been an off day?

Tried the classic 2 piece fried chicken, with green beans as a side, and corn bread, to go. Also had the limeade.

The fried chicken skin texture was great, crispy. The meat though was quite dry, not tender or moist.

Limeade tasted ok.

AMAZING STAFF and the food was amazing!! You could smell the chicken a block away before they even opened, and it tasted just as good as it smelled! The chicken was pan-fried, so it was juicy, crispy, and flavorful without being greasy. The sugar cane on top was such a unique and delicious touch.

The drinks were refreshing ‚Äî the limeade was my favorite, though a little sweet (I‚Äôd mix it with water next time). The desserts were sweet but still light, and the sides were all vegan ‚Äî a healthier take on traditional comfort sides without losing flavor.

The turkey wings were fall-off-the-bone tender, and the jerk BBQ had the perfect balance of sweet with a little kick. I also loved the blackfish tacos, especially the sauce with that hint of sweetness.

On top of the amazing food, the staff was so kind and welcoming, even sharing a bit of history with me. Overall, such a wonderful experience ‚Äî incredible food and even better people.

Charles fried chicken!!! This place rocks. Top 10 chicken in NYC easy on anyone list

But to be completely honest I just ordered in and I really wouldn‚Äôt recommend it if you‚Äôre 20 blocks away it definitely didn‚Äôt hit the same. I have had this many times and it‚Äôs definitely one of the best fried chickens in the city.

I‚Äôm not sure if it was cuz it‚Äôs close to closing time or just the delivery I‚Äôll have to try and order it again soon to see definitely going to do it earlier to see if it‚Äôs better.

Got the white rice (I definitely would pass on this) should have done the greens

The pees was ok

The Mac and cheese always hit

The corn bread was a bit dry but again I‚Äôm guessing it‚Äôs because of the time. It‚Äôs late so maybe it sat for a bit normally it‚Äôs top tear.

I can‚Äôt blame them for the delivery especially since I‚Äôve had it in person so many times and it was always consistent

I definitely recommend this place definitely visit it‚Äôs many locations and you won‚Äôt be disappointed

Ordering or delivery I can‚Äôt promise anything on that but if you go u will enjoy it.

IG imbroke_rob

Thanks again for following me hope you enjoy the reviews

Food ! Delish ! Janelle & Trey were amazing in customer service! Legit the best! For my first time I had a great experience with my family. We will be back ! Ok had to add to my review. The customer service is phenomenal. Highly recommend. Felt like I was home.
Very friendly service and impeccable food. The chicken was sooo juicy and seasoned well. Would definitely recommend picking up some Mac and cheese too!!

Now, this is about and southern as you can find. Large black iron skillets with golden fried chicken! Sweet cornbread. This is a good find. I plan to come back when I come to NY. Oh, and thr friendly faces. Great business.

I love grabbing Charles Pan Fried chicken once in a blue! However this now the 3rd time in my past visits when they forgot to give me my cornbread, even after reminding the employees twice. It‚Äôs frustrating going all the way home and then realizing it‚Äôs not in the bag. Management needs to make sure employees are reminded of what orders come with what. Hopefully my next visit will be a bit different.

The food was nice. Everything looks clean. However, the chicken looked dry when I first opened the box. The skin was crispy and fragrant. The meat inside was also somewhat dry. At least for the one piece of thigh and the breast piece I got, they were dry from the inside out. The other piece of thigh was perfect, the meat was tender and juicy inside. The corn bread was very nice and nice. Not too crumbly and not too sweet. The two sides I got were also very good. I got a potato salad and a baked Mac and cheese. Both were very flavorful and not too salty. Overall, the sides were much better than their famous pan fried chicken. Maybe I‚Äôll come back and try again when I‚Äôm in the neighborhood, but honestly I was a little disappointed.

Everything about this place is great, first off came in for a three piece plate and two sides. Walked in and saw them frying the chicken in the pan and everything is made there. Paid $19 for the meal which came with a generous portion of chicken and they give you the option of white or dark meat. Sides were enough to feed two people. Staff was really friendly and they even give you a wet napkin for after you eat to clean the grease from your hands. White meat is usually dry but this was moist and you could tell the difference between deep fried and pan fried. Gotta say what surprised me the most was the cornbread, came as the size of a softball and gotta say was the moistest cornbread I ever had, you could eat it without a bev. Their plates definitely can feed two people.

Everytime you walk into this establishment you are greeted with a warm welcome, puts a smile on your face. Makes you feel like you are walking into grandmas house!

When it comes to the food, the chicken is outstanding: crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside, and seasoned just right. You can taste the love in every bite. The mac and cheese and candied yams are just as amazing ‚Äî pure comfort food.

The staff are always friendly, the service is fast and reliable. Pure Harlem soul. I‚Äôll definitely be back!

Most amazing southern eats you can get outside of the South itself!

Ordered online for pick up and got the 3-chicken meal that comes with corn bread and two sides, only for $18.99.

Ofc had to top it off with sweet tea, lemonade (homemade!!), and banana pudding.

Amazing experience!

Ë∂ÖÁ¥öÁ∂ìÂÖ∏ÁöÑÁÇ∏ÈõûÔºåÂ•ΩÂêÉÂà∞‰∏çË°åüíñüíñüíñ
The Corn bread is awesome!!!
Jamal is sweet üíñüòé

First off, everything is FABULOUS x Infinity! We had a taste test party and I just wanted more. The fried chicken was everything, nice and crispy but I couldn't put it down. The mac & cheese you could taste the sharpness of the cheese. The collard greens, man it made you wanna slap yo mama!

I was officially done when I tasted the ribs and THAT SAUCE! Wow, little spicy, little sweet but oh so right. We wanted at least one thing to not taste good, but that was an epic fail. Everything is all thumbs up. The yams, potato salad was oh so delicious.

Then there's dessert...we chose the banana pudding. Now I have made banana pudding from scratch but this right here, its fluffy and delicious.

You know you're in serious trouble when even the lemonade and the ice tea is 10s across the board. 5 stars doesn't do it justice!
Thank you Charles for putting us into a food coma! Now we gotta try the Fish Fridays!

Seen this place on my TikTok feed, was out near Harlem. Atmosphere was basically a take out spot, nothing special just a showing of Chicken, Collard Greens, Candid Yams, Mac n Cheese. Chicken was good but definitely thought it would taste better, Mac n Cheese was good but definitely feels like something was missing. Cornbread was definitely on point. Had the classic for $10, can't complain at all.

I thought this place had closed during pandemic, so I was pleasantly surprised to see there were 3 locations to choose from. I knew I should have gone to the flagship location, but I decided to go to 125 instead. Bad move. Charles wasn‚Äôt there and he was always around the other two stores when I would stop in. The 1st girl seemed new but she was pleasant and welcoming. The other girl short with braids asked if I wanted 2 pieces with the plate which threw me because the plate comes with 3 pieces. Then she asked white meat or dark and proceeded to give me legs. I didn‚Äôt notice it with the smothered order but I noticed with mine. Then she takes the little tray for my chicken, so I say to her just give me the same tray you gave for the smothered chicken and she ignored me and proceeded to put it in the small tray that wouldn‚Äôt close and wrapped a rubber band around it. When I saw my chicken hanging out I asked for a bigger tray again. She apologized and told me that‚Äôs what she was told to do. Regarding the food. Chicken had a lot of fat and skin. Made me feel like it wasn‚Äôt cleaned. Chicken was missing something. The smothered chicken is usually cooked in the gravy but she took the regular fried chicken and poured dark gravy on top. Like gravy for the mashed potatoes. Not how Charles had it in other stores. Sides were delicious. Big portions.

I haven‚Äôt had okra since I was a little girl, but I tried it today at the suggestion of another customer and it was delicious! Seasoned just right and not slimy at all. As usual the atmosphere was welcoming, the music was on point and the customer service was top tier. Shout out to Freddy she‚Äôs always bright and cheery and she got me out in no time!
Definitely a great place! I live couple of kicks away! Definitely coming back more often! Please please get the üç† yam and the mac&cheese! We definitely loved it.

I don‚Äôt usually speak down on Black businesses, that‚Äôs never my style. I know the grind, I know what it takes to even open those doors. But I‚Äôm tired of walking into spots in Harlem and being treated like my money don‚Äôt count just because I used an app and got the ‚Äúdiscount‚Äù plate

Twice now I pulled up to this soul food spot. First time, dude acted like handing me a bag of food was doing me a favor. Negative energy all through it. I‚Äôm outside, thinking about leaving a review, and suddenly he slides me a bag like I‚Äôm supposed to be grateful
but still with the attitude.

Second time, same story. Same person. Same vibe. I ordered heavy from this place before, paid full price, never had a problem. But the minute I use Too Good To Go? Different treatment. Like now I‚Äôm less than. Like I don‚Äôt deserve respect because I didn‚Äôt pay ‚Äútop dollar.

It‚Äôs not even the food  food is good. It‚Äôs the way some workers move. I‚Äôve met cool people in that same restaurant who show love. But one bad apple at the front can poison the whole tree. If I was the owner, I‚Äôd never let that slide. You don‚Äôt intimidate customers, you don‚Äôt make them feel small.

Here‚Äôs the truth: you get more love from the Spanish spots or the white-owned spots on that app than you do from some of our own. And that hurts to say. But it‚Äôs real. I‚Äôm all for supporting us, but I can‚Äôt keep supporting a place that treats me like I‚Äôm begging. I pay for my food. Respect that.

I‚Äôll speak on this on my radio show, not out of hate, but out of love hoping somebody listens. Because at the end of the day, we should be treating our people better, not worse. Kindness don‚Äôt cost a thing

bit of a letdown

temperature of my chicken was a tier colder than lukewarm and it didn't really have much flavor. still an okay piece of fried chicken.

i did like the way I didn't feel gross afterwards, it was hardly oily.
Ah-mazing service! Best fried chicken ever (and I‚Äôm from the South.) Trey & Janel are top tier in excellent customer service and my experiences have been GREAT!

I was recommended this place that if I was ever in the area it was a must stop. My kids were coming back to Long Island and happen to be in the area so made this a definite stop. What a waste of time and money. The staff took over 45 minutes to insulate us by packing burnt fried chicken and beyond hard catfish that couldn‚Äôt be eaten. The ribs were just boiled with no sauce and had a funny taste. I sent an email to the powers that be as the store manager of the 145th street location recommended when I called to complain. I felt it necessary to write a review especially after wasting $ 56.61 on food that I would not give my worst enemy.

The atmosphere brings you back to an authentic Southern Experience, along with this you receive the classic Southern hospitality by a worker named Janel. Finally, the food here is great, truly as someone from the South it reminds me so much of it and brings me back great memories of my grandmothers cooking. If you want a true Southern Experience then I would recommend coming here.
Smelled good food coming towards the door. I am visiting from Atlanta Ga. Food is amazing will be back.

It was such a good vibe upon first entrance. These are some quality people working here. Janel and Laila really got us right! And the food damnnnn!! chicken so good, mac and cheese bomb, corn bread fire. bruv tap in. nothin left! ate the bones and all!
Easy going place with great tasting soul food in Harlem. Fried chicken, yam, catfish tacos, jerked wings +++. Chef Quie and his staff are super nice and helpful!

I eat here a lot, whenever I‚Äôm in the neighborhood. Today I was serviced by Rica who was pleasant and patient while I made up my mind on which sides to eat with my 3 piece-pan fried chicken meal.  I went with the Lima beans over white rice, collards and of course the fried chicken with an Electric Slide, sweet drink.  Now I‚Äôm ready for my long train ride to Bedstuy, Utica. The A train is right up the block!

The only thing that really tops the meal you get here is the helpful staff. Trey and Dell were so helpful and friendly packing up our order. Don‚Äôt be fooled by the casual exterior, the service is amazing! While eating we watched Trey come out and clean off a table for some customers and when it was time to leave Dell rushed to help grab our trash. Amazing food complimented by a thoughtful team.

Charles Pan-Fried Chicken was the food vendor for  Uptown Bounce: Retro Rewind 80s to 2000s at The Museum of the City of New York.

The food, service and set-up were top-notch.  The food selections were fried or jerk chicken with two sides and cornbread and everything was scrumptious. They even offered sweet tea-the table wine of the south.  What a sweet treat!

The women hosting and serving were so pleasant and helpful too.  I also loved that Mr. Charles was onsite too.  A true African-American southern experience....in NYC.
Experience was GREAT! Janel cares for his customers and makes sure to offer top notch customer service!

Charles Fried Chicken is a true gem at UWS! This spot offers the perfect comfort food fix for those hectic lunch days. I come here regularly because the food is consistently amazing‚Äîeach meal is freshly cooked and bursting with flavor. The homemade lemonade/iced tea half drink is a refreshing treat, and the signature homemade sauce takes the dishes to the next level. The staff is incredibly friendly, always going the extra mile to make sure every regular feels appreciated. If you‚Äôre looking for a satisfying, hearty meal that feels like a warm hug, Charles Fried Chicken is the place to be. Elaine is the manager of this spot and she‚Äôs super friendly! Elijah- the cashier is also super energetic and friendly. Highly recommended!

The fried chicken here is great, been coming here for a while and will continue doing so. The service is great and quick. This time around I decided to ask Deli for a dessert suggestion and he recommended the cheesecake, let me tell you it was one of the best if not the best cheesecake I ever had,  don‚Äôt sleep on the cheesecake. Thanks Deli

Having anticipated this visit for approximately six months, I recently traveled from Queens and am pleased to report that the experience was entirely worthwhile. The culinary offerings were exceptional, and the staff demonstrated both friendliness and professionalism. Special recognition is due to Jonel for his outstanding service.

The fried chicken, in particular, was noteworthy, exhibiting perfect seasoning, crispness, and succulence. The accompanying mac and cheese was equally delightful. I fully intend to return. Regrettably, due to my eagerness to dine, I neglected to capture any photographic documentation, a common oversight in my food reviews.

31August2025, I went to the location on 145th. I ordered 3 thighs, greens and banana pudding. Unfortunately the chicken is not as amazing as it was prior to the covid shutdown.  The greens are decent and have flavor. Honestly I can get the exact same fried chicken from Shoprite and sum canned collards it would be the same if not better.

Amazing staff with amazing vibes! The entry matches the food as well and can‚Äôt get enough of the ribs.

Definitely a must come if ever in the neighborhood or visiting NYC, and a huge shoutout to Janel & Poppa!
Beautiful costumer service. Was served by Janell. Amazing atmosphere. Delicious chicken. Recommend getting with barbecue and hot sauce.

10/10 experience! I was well taken care of from across street. This gentleman approached me with great mannerisms and offered to clean the outside seating for me and my friends. The lady serving was very patient with me in the combos, what‚Äôs popular and what to eat ( as it was my first time). Everything was great tbh. Not only the customer service but the quality of the food was 10/10! I enjoyed my meal now and know I will in 4 hours! lol! 10/10!!!

(only side note is that they do run out of certain sides and entrees as people buy throughout the day, so when I came ( at 9:15/9:30pm) there was no fish but it‚Äôs okay, I tried their chicken for the time and enjoyed it :)
